name: consent_form
label:
This page is designed to provide you with information about this study to help you to decide whether you wish to participate. 

In this study we will ask you to answer questions about your preferences for song lyrics. We will then ask you to read samples of song lyrics, and to answer some questions about them. By clicking ""Agree"" below, you certify that you have read, understood, and agree to the following:

 

1. Your participation is completely voluntary, and you may end your participation at any time. 
 

2. You will be asked some questions: First, you will be asked about your preferences for song lyrics. Next, you will be asked to read the lyrics to several songs and to answer some questions about your perceptions of them. 
 

3. The team of researchers currently working on this study will have access to this data. In addition, journal article reviewers and researchers from accredited institutions may have access to de-identified versions of this data set. In the event that this occurs, no personally identifying information will be included with the transfered dataset. 
 

4. If desired, you will receive a digital copy of your data. You may also instruct this research team to purge your data, all or in part, at any time. 
 

5. Excerpts of the data collected in this study may appear in scientific research papers, conference presentations, public presentations, and media presentations. In the event that this occurs, no personally identifying information will be included. 
 

6. Anonymized data will be kept and maintained confidentially by researcher Andrew M. Demetriou at Delft University of Technology. Researchers working with Andrew M. Demetriou will also have access to the data. Upon conclusion of the study, de-identified data will be maintained on the Open Science Framework (osf.io). 

7. Details regarding the purposes of this study will be revealed in a debriefing description on-screen at the conclusion of this survey, so as not to bias your responses.
 

8. Additional questions you may have may be directed to Andrew M. Demetriou: a.m.demetriou@tudelft.nl.  


We anticipate that your participation in this study will require about 30 minutes.

name: lyric_prefs_instructions_1
label:
### __Instructions:__ 
#### On the following page, you'll be asked how much you agree with a number of statements. 
#### The statements will describe behaviors associated with song lyrics. 
#### You'll be asked to show how much you agree to the statements by clicking on a bar that looks like this:

name: lyric_prefs_instructions_test_1
label: Click on the grey bar to indicate how much you agree.

name: lyric_prefs_instructions_2
label:
#### The closer you click to the left, the more you show that you agree with the statement; the more you click to the right, the more you disagree with the statement. 

###Warning: Lyrics were taken from popular music and may contain offensive language, or describe offensive situations.

name: submit_lyric_prefs_instructions
label: Continue:

name: lyrics_prefs_instructions_3
label: Please indicate the degree to which you agree with the following statements:

name: lyric_prefs_1
label: I prefer music that contains lyrics, as opposed to music that does not

name: lyric_prefs_2
label: I only pay attention to the lyrics of songs or artists that I like.

name: lyric_prefs_3
label: I always pay attention to the lyrics of a song, if the song has them

name: lyric_prefs_4
label: I enjoy learning about song lyrics and their meaning, for example by reading  blogs and forums or listening to artist interviews

name: lyric_prefs_5
label: If a song has lyrics that I don't like for any reason, I don't listen to it

name: lyric_prefs_6
label: If I am not sure about the lyrics of a song, I look them up

name: lyric_prefs_7
label: I contribute to online resources on lyrics, for example forums, or on platforms where I can contribute lyric transcriptions

name: lyric_prefs_8
label: I memorize the lyrics to the songs I listen to

name: lyric_prefs_9
label: I write my own song lyrics

name: lyric_prefs_10
label: I post excerpts of song lyrics online, e.g. on social media

name: lyric_prefs_11
label: I discuss song lyrics with my friends

name: lyric_prefs_12
label: I come up with alternate versions of song lyrics that I find entertaining, i.e. song parodies

name: lyric_prefs_13
label: I ponder the meaning of song lyrics

name: lyric_prefs_14
label: I quote lyrics often in conversation

name: lyric_prefs_15
label: I read and/or write poetry

name: lyric_prefs_16
label: What percentage of your music library do you think contains songs with lyrics? Please make your best guess using the gray bar below:

name: lyric_activities_instructions
label: Can you think of any other activities or indications that someone has an affinity for song lyrics? If so, please enter them here:

name: submit_lyrics
label: Continue:

name: annotation_instructions_1
label:
###__Instructions:__ 
#### Thanks!
#### You will now be shown lyrics from songs, and asked to complete some questions about how you perceive them. 
#### IMPORTANT: Lyrics can be written from different perspectives, some of which are not the same as the writer of the lyrics. In other words, the AUTHOR of the lyrics may choose a SPEAKER for their lyrics that is not themselves. 
 
#### The SPEAKER of the lyrics could be could be a fictional character, a real person from history or the present, or even an imaginary object.  And of course it could be the AUTHOR themselves. Please answer the questions while thinking about the SPEAKER. WARNING: These lyrics are drawn from popular music, some of which use offensive language or describe offensive situations. Also, questions may sometimes take a few seconds to load. Thank you for your patience! 
####

name: submit_annotation_instructions
label: Continue:

name: L_123456_instructions
label: Please, rate the importance of the following values as a life-guiding principle for the SPEAKER of the lyrics by clicking on the grey bar. The closer you click to the left, the more you indicate that the value is opposed to their values, and clicking further to the right indicates that the value is of supreme importance to their principles.

name: L_123456_1
label: POWER (social power, authority, wealth)

name: L_123456_2
label: ACHIEVEMENT (success, capability, ambition, influence on people and events)

name: L_123456_3
label: HEDONISM (gratification of desires, enjoyment in life, self- indulgence)

name: L_123456_4
label: STIMULATION (daring, a varied and challenging life, an exciting life)

name: L_123456_5
label: SELF-DIRECTION (creativity, freedom, curiosity, independence, choosing one's own goals)

name: L_123456_6
label: UNIVERSALISM (broad-mindedness, beauty of nature and arts, social justice, a world at peace, equality, wisdom, unity with nature, environmental protection)

name: L_123456_7
label: BENEVOLENCE (helpfulness, honesty, forgiveness, loyalty, responsibility)

name: L_123456_8
label: TRADITION (respect for tradition, humbleness, accepting one's portion in life, devotion, modesty)

name: L_123456_9
label: CONFORMITY (obedience, honoring parents and elders, self- discipline, politeness)

name: L_123456_10
label: SECURITY (national security, family security, social order, cleanliness, reciprocation of favors)

name: L_123456_c
label: How confident are you in your ratings of these lyrics?

name: L_123456_r
label: Was there anything specific about the lyrics that makde you unconfident in your ratings? (Optional)   e.g. they containted words or slang that you didn't know, the words in the lyrics were incorrect, or they were too poetic or abstract to interpret

name: L_123456_submit_2
label: Continue:

name: subjectiveness
label:
Something is subjective if it is influenced by personal feelings, tastes or opinions. On the other hand, something is objective if it is not influenced by personal feelings, tastes or opinions. 

You were asked to read lyrics and rate them in terms of the values that were present. How subjective do you think this task was?

name: subjectiveness_submit
label: Continue:

name: debrief
label:
Thanks for completing the survey! 
 
Our research group is interested in perceived personal values in song lyrics. Some people might have a strong preference for song lyrics, or pay more attention to them when they listen. We asked a number of questions about your song lyric preferences.

Personal values are defined as abstract concepts or beliefs. They are related to our behaviors and goals at the most abstract level, above an beyond any specific situation. According to Shalom Schwartz, there are 10 main values that all people share, and each person has their own ranking of these values. In more recent work, these are broken up further into 19 values; we used an older 10-item questionnaire. 
 
This study is helping us learn how to gather data from people about the values that they think song lyrics express. This questionnaire is based on one that was a part of the European Social Survey. However, in that version, individuals were responding about themselves and not song lyrics. We will investigate whether this questionnaire is also useful for gathering information on song lyrics.
